betterquesting:10.desc:8:
Have you heard of pebble reactors? Have you heard of Pebble Bed reactors? Well now you have both!

The High Temperature Gas-cooled Reactor (HTGR) uses specially prepared fuel pellets to heat coolant gas (helium) that's pumped in a closed loop through the reactor and heat exchangers. The reactor requires a constant supply of helium gas and power in order to power the pump that keeps the coolant loop working.

This reactor allows breeding of rare resources (§5Indium§r,§9Osmium§r), fissile materials (§aU235§r,§cPu239§r,§4Pu241§r), can supply you with §dLutetium§r and also unlocks alternative recipes for §dEuropium§r and §7Americium§r via the elusive §2Promethium§r.

The disadvantage of this reactor is it's expensive nature. Pebble reactors work by stuffing the reactor full of pebbles, none of which require rare resources but rather a large amount of common ones. Even though a lot can be recycled, you still need to keep the reactor filled to get decent speed. As a reward for this upkeep cost, you get a decent production for many different outputs.
[note]
Notes:

HTGR has an internal buffer for fuel and gets faster the more fuel you put inside according to the formula §6eff=1-(1-x)^3§r

This multi consumes 0.2A IV when operating and this amount increases when lacking helium gas. 
The amount of Helium gas increases with the amount of helium gas stored.

Reactor speeds up immensely when supplied with either/both IC2 Coolant or Water, if the amount of supplied fluid is not full the bonus speed is applied linearly.

By typing HTGR in NEI, you can see all the items that are related to this multiblock.

For exact numbers visit HTGR-Controller-Tooltip.as/always
[/note]
